title: Ensure compliance of resources provisioned outside Cloud Management
content:
Tags can help you manage, identify, organize, search for, and filter resources. With tagged resources, admin users and management personnel can:

  • Identify the resources provisioned by each team/team member. Teams that are part of a centralized cost center can share a resource. By having proper tags in place, it's easier to break up the incurred cost and charge back the teams as appropriate.
  • Identify the hierarchical consumption of cloud resources in a team.

This use case describes how to ensure your cloud resources provisioned outside OpenText Cloud Management have proper tags assigned.

This use case involves the following personas.

Persona Role Responsibilities

Stephen 

 Compliance Administrator or Engineer

Create a policy and ensure that it is run as per schedule

Set up the dashboard report and the report that needs to be sent to account owner or group

Derek

 Application Engineer

Assign the appropriate tags in the expected format to provisioned resources and make them compliant. 
Tom IT Operations Take corrective measures to ensure compliance.

Stephen wants to identify the noncompliant resources provisioned outside of the OpenText Cloud Management environment. After identifying such resources, Stephen can generate a noncompliance report and share it with concerned teams, account owners, or both. To fulfill this use case, Stephen can use the Cloud Management -UCMDB policy engine.

Upon receiving the noncompliance report, the teams, account owners, or both, can assign the required tags and make the resources compliant.

Prerequisites

  1. OpenText Cloud Management is installed with the DND and Cloud Management Platform FinOps capabilities.
  2. UCMDB is installed.

Create a policy

In CMS, create a policy as follows:

  1. UCMDB UI Home > UD/UCMDB Modules > Modeling > Query Designer > Create Policy 
  2. Query Designer Wizard > POLICY step > expand the right slider > Create New Policy.
  3. Add a condition for which the tag is null.
  4. Save the policy.

For information on creating a policy and adding conditions, see Policy Wizard in the UCMDB documentation.

Identify the untagged (noncompliant) resources

Perform the following steps in UD/UCMDB:

  1. Go to UCMDB UI Home > UD/UCMDB Modules > Resource Manager > Query folder > Policy folder > click the policy > click the context menu button > click Open in Query Designer.
  2. In the Query Designer Wizard, select POLICY.
  3. Click Calculate and select Show instances. (include icons image)

The Query Designer now lists every instance of the provisioned resources that don't have any tags assigned.

You can download this report as a CSV, XLS, PDF, or XLSX file.

Create a Report widget 

To automate the task of identifying the noncompliant resources, create a report widget. For information, see Use case - create a Report widget in the UCMDB documentation.

Once you create the report widget, you can find the report on the dashboard. 

Schedule the report

Schedule the noncompliance report to be sent to respective account owners/teams so that they can assign the required tags and make the resources compliant. To do this, create a schedule for the report. For information, see Reports in the UCMDB documentation.

Apply tags (make the provisioned resources compliant)

As an account owner/team member, when you receive a noncompliance report, you can apply appropriate tags to such resources to meet the compliance requirements.

Perform the following steps:

  1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
  2. From the main menu go to Run > Automation Operations.
  3. Select the Flow Launcher tab.
  4. Select the required OO flow. Example: Azure Post Deployment tags. 
  5. In the vmResourceID field, specify the resource ID mentioned in the noncompliance report, and click Run.

The OO flow will now automatically assign the required tags thereby making the resource compliant.
